citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC)
citeinfo.title: Primary Productivity in Offshore Areas

descript.abstract: Measurements of primary productivity. In addition to cruise information, position, date, time, sampling depth and environmental information, this file may contain measured parameters of nutrients, chlorophyll a and carbon assimilation. Also included are data from the Outer Continental Shelf Environmental Assessment Program. On-line documentation is available on the NOSIE system located on the NODC VAX computer and the NODC User's guide.
descript.purpose: The data are collected to provide information on nutrient levels and nutrient flow in offshore areas.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
